newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Santos to develop Stag oil field.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Santos to develop Stag oil field.

text.p: Oil and gas producer Santos Ltd said on Thursday the WA209-P joint venture had committed to the A$200 million development of the Stag oil field in the Carnarvon basin, offshore Western Australia.
Santos has a 54.17 percent stake in the venture, the other participants being the operator, Apache Corp with 33.33 percent and Globex Mining Enterprises Inc 12.5 percent.
Santos said its share of the development was A$117.9 million including its requirement to fund Globex's interest through a portion of the development.

"Stag is a significant field with an expected life of at least 13 years - it will provide a solid foundation for future growth of the company," Santos managing director Ross Adler said in a statement.
The Stag field, discovered in June 1993, is located in 46 metres of water, 30 km north west of Dampier.
The company said gross proved and probable reserves in the field were estimated to be 43.8 million barrels of oil of which Santos' share is 23.7 million barrels.
"The first full year of production is expected to average 26,200 barrels of oil per day," the company said.
The development scheme for the field involves the fabrication and installation of a fixed central production platform.
Santos said the oil would be exported from the production platform through a subsea flow line connected via a mooring buoy to a floating storage facility about two kilometres away.
